leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 科研代理-工具调用与工作流编排生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 规划→调用→追踪→回放→评测→治理

queries: [WEB] openapi to json schema for ai agents github

tools.name: Instructor (Python)
tools.one_line_profile: Library for structured data extraction and validation from LLMs using Pydantic
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the process of extracting structured data from Large Language Models (LLMs) by leveraging Pydantic for schema validation. It is essential for scientific agents requiring precise data extraction from literature or structured tool inputs.

tools.name: Instructor (Go)
tools.one_line_profile: Go client for structured LLM outputs and data extraction
tools.detailed_description: The Go implementation of the Instructor library, enabling structured data extraction and validation from LLMs within Go-based scientific workflows and agent backends.

tools.name: Instructor (TypeScript)
tools.one_line_profile: TypeScript library for structured LLM extraction using Zod
tools.detailed_description: The TypeScript/JavaScript version of Instructor, utilizing Zod for schema definition to ensure type-safe structured outputs from LLMs, suitable for web-based scientific interfaces and agents.

tools.name: Instructor (Ruby)
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby library for structured outputs from LLMs
tools.detailed_description: The Ruby implementation of the Instructor pattern, facilitating structured data handling from LLMs for Ruby-based research tools and scripts.

tools.name: Instructor (Rust)
tools.one_line_profile: Rust crate for structured LLM outputs
tools.detailed_description: The Rust implementation of Instructor, providing high-performance, type-safe structured extraction from LLMs, suitable for computationally intensive scientific agent backends.

tools.name: tuui
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop client for Model Context Protocol (MCP) orchestration
tools.detailed_description: A desktop client designed to accelerate AI adoption through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling cross-vendor LLM API orchestration and tool integration, which is critical for multi-model scientific workflows.

tools.name: tiny_fnc_engine
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal engine for executing LLM-generated function calls
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library that provides a flexible engine for parsing and executing function calls extracted from LLMs, serving as a building block for custom scientific agents.

tools.name: open-ptc-agent
tools.one_line_profile: Agent implementation for programmatic tool calling via MCP
tools.detailed_description: An open-source implementation of an AI agent focused on code execution and programmatic tool calling using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), suitable for automating computational scientific tasks.

tools.name: Composio Function Calling Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for LLM function calling capabilities
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool designed to evaluate and test the function calling performance of various Large Language Models, aiding researchers in selecting appropriate models for agentic workflows.

tools.name: Composio
tools.one_line_profile: Integration platform for AI agents to interface with external tools
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform and library that equips AI agents and LLMs with extensive integrations via function calling, serving as a critical infrastructure for building agents that interact with external software and APIs.

tools.name: HuggingFists
tools.one_line_profile: Low-code data flow tool for LLM pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A low-code data flow tool that facilitates the construction of processing pipelines using LLMs and HuggingFace models, enabling researchers to build complex data processing workflows without extensive coding.

tools.name: Chat2Anything
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based knowledge base QA system
tools.detailed_description: An LLM-based tool designed to chat with documents and databases, providing a management system for enterprise or research knowledge bases, facilitating literature review and data querying.

tools.name: GPT_ALL
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for multi-step asynchronous function calling
tools.detailed_description: A project combining LLMs with multi-step asynchronous function calling, NLP, and TTS, providing a framework for building complex, interactive AI agents.

tools.name: AnyTool
tools.one_line_profile: Universal tool-use layer for AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A framework implementing a universal tool-use layer for AI agents, designed to enhance the capability of LLMs to interact with a wide variety of tools effectively, supporting complex agentic workflows.

tools.name: AutoAgent
tools.one_line_profile: Fully-automated zero-code LLM agent framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for generating and managing LLM-based agents without coding, automating the process of agent creation and workflow orchestration, suitable for rapid prototyping of scientific assistants.

tools.name: MCP Context Forge
tools.one_line_profile: Gateway and registry for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools and resources
tools.detailed_description: A centralized management point for tools, resources, and prompts accessible by MCP-compatible LLM applications. It converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers, and handles protocol conversions, serving as a critical infrastructure component for AI agent toolchains.

tools.name: Patito
tools.one_line_profile: Data modeling and validation layer for Polars dataframes
tools.detailed_description: A library built on top of Polars and Pydantic that provides a structured data modeling layer. It allows for the definition of schemas and validation of dataframes, which is essential for ensuring data quality and consistency in scientific data processing pipelines.

tools.name: UniversalLLMFunctionCaller
tools.one_line_profile: Planner for enabling function calling on chat-based LLMs via Semantic Kernel
tools.detailed_description: A planner integration for Semantic Kernel that enables function calling capabilities on various chat-based Large Language Models (LLMs) such as Mistral, Bard, and Claude. It acts as an adapter to standardize tool invocation across different models.

tools.name: Composio MCP Server
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server for Composio tool integration
tools.detailed_description: An MCP server implementation that connects LLMs to the Composio platform, enabling agents to access and utilize a wide range of external tools and integrations. It facilitates the orchestration of complex workflows by providing a standardized interface for tool execution.

tools.name: Open Assistant API
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source framework for agent orchestration and tool management
tools.detailed_description: A self-hosted framework for creating and orchestrating agents/GPTs. It supports customized extensions for LLMs, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), function calling, and tool capabilities, providing a backend for building scientific research assistants.

tools.name: LangChain GPT Researcher
tools.one_line_profile: LangChain tool wrapper for the GPT Researcher autonomous agent
tools.detailed_description: Integrates GPT Researcher as a tool within the LangChain ecosystem, allowing agents to perform autonomous online research, scrape web content, and synthesize information for scientific literature review and data gathering tasks.

tools.name: ToolAgents
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight framework for creating function-calling agents
tools.detailed_description: A flexible framework designed to facilitate the creation of agents capable of function calling with various language models and APIs. It abstracts the complexity of tool definition and invocation, streamlining the development of agentic workflows.

tools.name: MiniMax MCP
tools.one_line_profile: Official Model Context Protocol server for MiniMax AI models
tools.detailed_description: Provides an MCP interface to interact with MiniMax's suite of AI models, including Text-to-Speech, image generation, and video generation. This server enables scientific agents to leverage multimodal generation capabilities within a standardized protocol.

tools.name: ToolRegistry
tools.one_line_profile: Protocol-agnostic tool management library for function-calling LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to manage tool definitions and registrations for Large Language Models with function calling capabilities. It provides a unified interface to register tools and generate the necessary schemas for different LLM providers.

tools.name: ToolBridge
tools.one_line_profile: Universal function calling adapter for LLMs
tools.detailed_description: Enables tool and function calling capabilities for LLMs that do not natively support them, or standardizes the interface across OpenAI and Ollama API formats. It acts as a bridge to add agentic capabilities to a wider range of models.

tools.name: OpenAPI Generator CLI
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for generating API clients and servers from OpenAPI specifications
tools.detailed_description: The command-line interface for OpenAPI Generator, which allows for the automatic generation of API client libraries, server stubs, and documentation from OpenAPI (Swagger) schemas. In the context of AI agents, it is a fundamental tool for creating the interfaces that allow agents to interact with scientific services and data repositories.

tools.name: Dive
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop MCP host application for LLM function calling
tools.detailed_description: An open-source desktop application that serves as a host for the Model Context Protocol (MCP). It integrates with LLMs to provide a runtime environment for function calling and tool execution, enabling users to run agentic workflows locally.

tools.name: DeepDoc
tools.one_line_profile: Deep research tool for local knowledge base analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for deep research tasks using local knowledge bases. It likely employs RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) techniques to analyze documents and synthesize information, aiding in scientific literature review and data analysis.

tools.name: LangChain Prefect
tools.one_line_profile: Integration tools for using LangChain within Prefect workflows
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides integration between LangChain (agent framework) and Prefect (workflow orchestration). It enables the building of robust, observable, and resilient AI agent workflows for scientific tasks.

tools.name: MCP Framework
tools.one_line_profile: TypeScript framework for building Model Context Protocol servers
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to simplify the development of MCP servers in TypeScript. It provides the necessary abstractions and utilities to create tools and resources that comply with the Model Context Protocol, facilitating the expansion of the AI agent tool ecosystem.

tools.name: CoexistAI
tools.one_line_profile: Modular research assistant framework for automating workflows with LLMs and tool calls
tools.detailed_description: A developer-friendly framework designed to build, search, summarize, and automate research workflows. It integrates LLMs with web search and mapping tools through simple MCP tool calls, enabling the automation of complex information gathering and synthesis tasks in scientific research.

tools.name: LLMCompiler
tools.one_line_profile: Compiler for optimizing parallel function calling in LLM agents
tools.detailed_description: An LLM compiler designed to execute function calls in parallel, significantly speeding up agentic workflows. It analyzes the dependency graph of tool calls generated by the LLM and schedules them for efficient execution, addressing the latency bottleneck in complex sequential reasoning tasks.

tools.name: AppWorld
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking environment for interactive coding agents and function calling
tools.detailed_description: A controllable environment of apps and people designed to benchmark the capabilities of autonomous agents in function calling and interactive coding. It provides a high-quality dataset and execution environment to evaluate how well agents can interact with APIs and manage state in complex scenarios.

tools.name: Tanuki.py
tools.one_line_profile: Library for building LLM-powered functions with type safety
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows developers to build type-safe functions powered by LLMs. It simplifies the creation of neuro-symbolic applications by patching Python functions with LLM logic, enabling easy integration of alignment and function calling capabilities into software workflows.

tools.name: ActionWeaver
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for orchestrating function calling and tool management for LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to simplify the integration of function calling capabilities into LLM applications. It provides tools for managing tool registries, orchestrating complex tool-use workflows, and handling the interaction between language models and external APIs.

tools.name: ToolBrain
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for agentic tool use training with reinforcement learning
tools.detailed_description: A framework focused on training AI agents to use tools effectively using reinforcement learning techniques. It addresses the challenge of teaching agents to select and execute the correct tools in multi-step reasoning processes.

tools.name: Tiger
tools.one_line_profile: Middleware library for enhancing AI agents with code execution and tool integration
tools.detailed_description: A library that acts as a bridge for AI agents (like LangChain, Autogen, CrewAI), providing them with capabilities such as code execution and advanced tool integration. It aims to enhance the 'brain' of the agent by facilitating complex interactions with the environment.

tools.name: MCP Gateway & Registry
tools.one_line_profile: Centralized registry and gateway for managing Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools
tools.detailed_description: An enterprise-ready gateway and registry designed to centralize AI development tools. It supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling secure authentication, dynamic tool discovery, and unified access for autonomous AI agents and coding assistants.

tools.name: ACI
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for unifying tool calling across agents and IDEs via MCP
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool-calling platform that connects hundreds of tools into agentic IDEs or custom AI agents. It utilizes direct function calling or a unified Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to standardize tool access and integration.

tools.name: Spring AI Alibaba
tools.one_line_profile: Java framework for building agentic AI applications with tool calling support
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Spring AI framework tailored for the Alibaba ecosystem. It provides Java developers with the tools to build agentic AI applications, including support for function calling, tool registration, and integration with various LLM providers.

tools.name: LangChain Visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for debugging and analyzing LangChain agent workflows
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to visualize and debug the execution flows of LangChain agents. It helps researchers and developers understand how agents are making decisions, calling tools, and processing data, which is critical for optimizing agentic workflows.

tools.name: Argilla
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for data curation and feedback loops to improve AI models
tools.detailed_description: A collaboration tool for AI engineers and domain experts to build high-quality datasets. It supports data annotation, curation, and feedback loops (RLHF), which are essential for training and fine-tuning scientific AI models and agents.

tools.name: Airflow AI SDK
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for integrating LLMs and AI Agents into Apache Airflow workflows
tools.detailed_description: A software development kit that enables the orchestration of AI agents and Large Language Model operations within Apache Airflow pipelines, facilitating complex scientific workflow automation.

tools.name: mcp-server-mysql
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server for MySQL database access
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that exposes MySQL databases to AI agents, enabling read-only schema inspection and query execution for scientific data retrieval.

tools.name: arxiv-mcp-server
tools.one_line_profile: MCP server for searching and analyzing arXiv papers
tools.detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol server designed to allow AI agents to search, retrieve, and analyze scientific papers from the arXiv repository, supporting automated literature review workflows.

tools.name: brightdata-mcp
tools.one_line_profile: MCP server for public web data collection
tools.detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol server that provides AI agents with capabilities for web scraping and public data collection, useful for gathering scientific datasets from web sources.

tools.name: DeerFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Research framework combining LLMs with external tools
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven framework for deep research automation that orchestrates Large Language Models with tools like web search, crawling, and code execution to perform complex information gathering and analysis tasks.

tools.name: tool2schema
tools.one_line_profile: Converter for Python functions to LLM tool schemas
tools.detailed_description: A utility library that automatically converts Python function signatures and docstrings into JSON schemas compatible with LLM function calling, facilitating the integration of scientific analysis code into AI agent workflows.

tools.name: Casibase
tools.one_line_profile: AI knowledge base and MCP management platform
tools.detailed_description: An open-source enterprise-level AI knowledge base and management platform for Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) interactions, supporting the organization and deployment of scientific knowledge and tools.

tools.name: mcpr
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust implementation of the Model Context Protocol, providing the infrastructure to build high-performance, memory-safe MCP servers and clients for scientific computing environments.

tools.name: DeepMCPAgent
tools.one_line_profile: LangChain agents powered by MCP tools
tools.detailed_description: A framework for creating model-agnostic AI agents that utilize Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools over HTTP/SSE, enabling the integration of diverse scientific tools into LangChain/LangGraph workflows.

tools.name: talksheet
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for querying data files with LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool that uses GPT models to answer questions about data contained in spreadsheets (CSV/Excel), facilitating quick exploratory data analysis.

tools.name: ChatMCP
tools.one_line_profile: AI chat client for Model Context Protocol
tools.detailed_description: A desktop client that implements the Model Context Protocol (MCP), allowing researchers to interact with and utilize various MCP-compliant scientific tools and agents through a chat interface.

tools.name: mysql_mcp_server
tools.one_line_profile: Secure MySQL MCP server for LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol server that provides secure, read-only access to MySQL databases, enabling LLMs to inspect schemas and execute queries for scientific data analysis.

tools.name: openapi-schema-ref-parser
tools.one_line_profile: OpenAPI Schema parser for LLM integration
tools.detailed_description: A utility to parse, resolve, and dereference OpenAPI Schema $ref pointers, specifically designed to prepare API definitions for consumption by Large Language Models in agentic workflows.

tools.name: ai-fns
tools.one_line_profile: Typesafe OpenAI Function calling utility
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight library to facilitate type-safe OpenAI function calling, simplifying the development of AI agents that need to invoke external scientific tools or functions.

tools.name: DocArray
tools.one_line_profile: Data structure for multimodal data
tools.detailed_description: A library for representing, sending, storing, and searching multimodal data (text, image, audio, video, 3D mesh), serving as a fundamental data structure for AI applications and scientific data processing.

tools.name: EmbedElite Semantic Kernel Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic Kernel plugin for EmbedElite
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Microsoft Semantic Kernel that enables AI agents to interact with EmbedElite services, facilitating knowledge retrieval and integration into agent workflows.

tools.name: Empower Functions
tools.one_line_profile: Function calling models and tools for real-world use cases
tools.detailed_description: A collection of models and tools optimized for GPT-4 level function calling, designed to enable AI agents to reliably interact with external tools and APIs in complex scenarios.

tools.name: mcp-playwright
tools.one_line_profile: Playwright MCP Server for browser automation
tools.detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol server that wraps Playwright, allowing AI agents to automate web browsers for tasks such as data collection, testing, and interaction with web-based scientific tools.

tools.name: mcptools
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for interacting with MCP servers
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool for testing, debugging, and interacting with Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, supporting both stdio and HTTP transports to facilitate tool development.

tools.name: Fiddler Auditor
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to evaluate robustness and correctness of language models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to evaluate Large Language Models (LLMs) by assessing their robustness to prompt perturbations and correctness of outputs, essential for ensuring reliability in AI-driven scientific workflows.

tools.name: Firesearch
tools.one_line_profile: AI-powered deep research tool for complex query resolution
tools.detailed_description: A deep research tool that leverages Firecrawl and LangGraph to break down complex queries, validate answers, and provide cited comprehensive results, functioning as an automated research assistant.

tools.name: Toolify
tools.one_line_profile: Function calling capabilities enabler for LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to empower Large Language Models with function calling capabilities, facilitating the integration of external tools into AI agents.

tools.name: Microchain
tools.one_line_profile: Minimalist framework for function calling-based LLM agents
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python framework for building Large Language Model agents that rely on function calling, providing a simple abstraction for tool usage and agent orchestration.

tools.name: Haiku RAG
tools.one_line_profile: Agentic RAG framework powered by LanceDB and Pydantic AI
tools.detailed_description: An opinionated agentic Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) tool that integrates LanceDB, Pydantic AI, and Docling to build advanced research agents capable of handling complex document queries.

tools.name: Gorilla CLI
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-powered command line interface tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool that leverages Large Language Models to generate and execute command-line commands, acting as an intelligent agent for system interaction and automation.

tools.name: MCP Adapt
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter to unlock MCP servers tools in agentic frameworks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that acts as an adapter to make Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and their tools accessible within various agentic frameworks, expanding the toolset available to AI agents.

tools.name: Chrome MCP Server
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server for browser automation
tools.detailed_description: A Chrome extension-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes browser functionality to AI assistants, enabling agents to perform browser automation, content analysis, and semantic search.

tools.name: Excel MCP Server
tools.one_line_profile: Model Context Protocol server for Excel file manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to allow AI agents to interact with and manipulate Excel files, facilitating data processing and analysis workflows.

tools.name: AgentSilex
tools.one_line_profile: Transparent and minimal agent framework
tools.detailed_description: A minimal and hackable Python framework for building AI agents, focusing on transparency and control without complex abstractions, suitable for research and custom agent development.

tools.name: LangChainGo MCP Adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter bridging LangChain Go tools with MCP servers
tools.detailed_description: A Go adapter that enables the integration of LangChain Go tools with Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, facilitating interoperability in the AI agent ecosystem.

tools.name: Ruby Nano Bots
tools.one_line_profile: Ruby implementation of small, AI-powered bots with tool calling
tools.detailed_description: A Ruby library for creating small, shareable AI-powered bots that support multiple LLM providers and tool calling (functions), enabling agentic workflows in Ruby environments.

tools.name: Swama
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for interacting with Swagger/OpenAPI definitions
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool for interacting with Swagger and OpenAPI definitions, useful for managing and testing API schemas used in AI tool calling and registry contexts.

tools.name: Instructor Evals
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation tool for extraction and reasoning capabilities
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for evaluating the quality and capabilities of extractions and reasoning performed by instructor clients, supporting the validation of structured outputs from LLMs.

tools.name: openapi2jsonschema
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from OpenAPI definitions to JSON schemas
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert OpenAPI definitions into JSON schemas, facilitating the use of API specifications in contexts requiring JSON schema validation, such as LLM function calling definitions.

tools.name: Function Calling Eval
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for evaluating function calls made by LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to evaluate the accuracy and correctness of function calls generated by Large Language Models, essential for benchmarking and improving agentic tool use.

tools.name: Native Tool Call Adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter for translating tool calls into native API formats
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that helps agents work more efficiently by translating tool calls from specific formats (like cline/Roo-Code) into native tool calls required by APIs, enhancing interoperability.

tools.name: Acte
tools.one_line_profile: Framework to build GUI-like Agent Tools
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed to build GUI-like Agent Tools, providing an enhancement to standard LLM function calling by structuring tool interactions more effectively.

tools.name: Magentic
tools.one_line_profile: Seamless integration of LLMs as Python functions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that allows developers to seamlessly integrate Large Language Models as Python functions, simplifying the process of function calling and structured output generation.

tools.name: LLM Auto Forge
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for dynamic creation and retrieval of agent tools
tools.detailed_description: A LangChain-based tool that enables agents to dynamically create, use, store, and retrieve tools to solve problems, enhancing the adaptability of AI agents.

tools.name: instructor-clj
tools.one_line_profile: Clojure library for structured output extraction from LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Clojure implementation of the Instructor pattern, enabling reliable extraction of structured data (JSON/Schema) from Large Language Models. This is essential for converting unstructured scientific text into structured datasets for analysis.

tools.name: ChatGPT CLI
tools.one_line_profile: CLI tool for LLM interaction with Model Context Protocol (MCP) support
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface for interacting with various LLM providers (OpenAPI, Azure, etc.) that supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This allows researchers to inject live data and context into LLM sessions, facilitating agentic workflows and tool usage.

tools.name: SemanticKernel.Assistants
tools.one_line_profile: Assistant extensions for Microsoft Semantic Kernel
tools.detailed_description: A library extending Microsoft Semantic Kernel to support hierarchical assistants and multi-assistant conversations. It enables the orchestration of complex agentic workflows where different agents (tools) collaborate on tasks.

tools.name: datamodel-code-generator
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for Pydantic models from JSON Schema and OpenAPI
tools.detailed_description: A utility that generates Pydantic models and dataclasses from JSON Schema, OpenAPI, and YAML data sources. In the context of AI Agents, this is a critical infrastructure tool for defining tool interfaces and validating structured outputs from LLMs.

tools.name: Deepagents
tools.one_line_profile: Agent harness for complex tasks built on LangChain/LangGraph
tools.detailed_description: An agent framework equipped with planning tools, filesystem backends, and sub-agent spawning capabilities. It is designed to handle complex, multi-step agentic tasks, suitable for orchestrating scientific research workflows.

tools.name: LangChain
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for developing applications powered by language models
tools.detailed_description: The de facto standard framework for building context-aware reasoning applications. It provides the essential infrastructure for scientific agents, including tool calling, memory, and chain-of-thought reasoning capabilities.

tools.name: langchain-mcp-adapters
tools.one_line_profile: LangChain adapters for Model Context Protocol (MCP)
tools.detailed_description: Provides adapters to integrate Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools into LangChain applications. This enables LangChain-based scientific agents to communicate with external data sources and tools using the standardized MCP interface.

tools.name: langchainjs-mcp-adapters
tools.one_line_profile: TypeScript adapters for Model Context Protocol (MCP) in LangChain.js
tools.detailed_description: The TypeScript/JavaScript equivalent of the MCP adapters for LangChain, enabling web-based or Node.js-based scientific agents to utilize MCP-compliant tools and data sources.

tools.name: LangChain4j
tools.one_line_profile: Java library for integrating LLMs and agents
tools.detailed_description: A Java library that simplifies the integration of LLMs into Java applications. It supports RAG, tool calling (including MCP), and agent orchestration, providing a robust foundation for enterprise-grade scientific applications in the Java ecosystem.

tools.name: mcp-agent
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building agents using Model Context Protocol
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to build effective agents specifically leveraging the Model Context Protocol (MCP) and simple workflow patterns. It streamlines the creation of agents that can discover and utilize standardized tools.

tools.name: Code-Interpreter-Api
tools.one_line_profile: Open source implementation of ChatGPT Code Interpreter
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a sandbox for LLMs to execute Python code, generate charts, and analyze data. This mimics the OpenAI Code Interpreter functionality, allowing local or custom agents to perform rigorous data analysis and visualization tasks.

tools.name: ollama-instructor
tools.one_line_profile: Structured output validation for Ollama models
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for the instruction and reliable validation of structured outputs (JSON) from LLMs running via Ollama. It uses Pydantic for schema definition, enabling deterministic data extraction workflows with local models.

tools.name: tool-ahead-of-time
tools.one_line_profile: Shim to add tool calling capabilities to LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that adds tool calling capabilities to LLM classes (like LangChain's ChatOpenAI) that might not natively support them or are waiting for framework updates. It facilitates the immediate use of new models in agentic tool-use workflows.

tools.name: toolhub
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of tools for LLM function calling
tools.detailed_description: A library providing a collection of pre-built tools designed for LLM function calling. It serves as a registry of ready-to-use functions that agents can invoke to perform specific tasks.

tools.name: mcp-go
tools.one_line_profile: Go implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP)
tools.detailed_description: A Go library implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling the creation of high-performance MCP servers and clients. This is core infrastructure for integrating external tools and data sources into the AI research agent ecosystem.

tools.name: mcphost
tools.one_line_profile: CLI host for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools
tools.detailed_description: A CLI application that acts as a host for Large Language Models to interact with external tools via the Model Context Protocol. It provides a runtime environment for testing and deploying MCP-compliant tools.

tools.name: Retrieval-Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for converting scientific PDFs into plain text for RAG and agents
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool designed to process scientific PDFs and convert them into plain text, facilitating the creation of RAG systems or agents specifically for academic knowledge and literature review.
